Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was able to leave the operation and walk about 5 miles to school alone.
Correction Narrative:
A child in care was able to leave the operation and walk about 5 miles to school alone.  

Gold Star Academy administrators shall ensure that employees clearly understand that any child requiring 1:1 supervision, must not be left unsupervised for any reason, for any short length of time.  In the case of a program or personal emergency, a second staff member must be present, taking on the responsibility of 1:1 supervision of the child in need.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member did not practice prudent judgement when walking away from a child on 1:1 supervision to perform other job duties.
Correction Narrative:
A staff member did not practice prudent judgement when walking away from a child on 1:1 supervision to perform other job duties. 

Gold Star Academy administrators shall ensure that employees clearly understand that any child requiring 1:1 supervision, must not be left unsupervised for any reason, for any short length of time.  In the case of a program or personal emergency, a second staff member must be present, taking on the responsibility of 1:1 supervision of the child in need.

Deficiency Narrative: A youth in care was not being administered his inhaler as prescribed by a medical professional's written order.
It was found through the course of the investigation that CCI made several attempts to contact a staff member for an interview during the investigation.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy administrators will ensure that all staff receive training regarding Inspections and Investigations.  Staff will be available to RCCI within 48 hours of request or will be removed from the work schedule until RCCI requests have been satisfied.  Gold Star personnel will receive this training in completion by September 1, 2024. 

Staff were interviewed regarding CCI investigation procedures, and staff has a good understanding of the procedures of an investigation and cooperation during the investigation. Staff were interviewed regarding CCI investigation procedures, and staff has a good understanding of the procedures of an investigation and cooperation during the investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found through the course of the investigation that a child was able to run into a wooded area during an outing in an attempt to run away.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the operation: Effective immediately, when an extra-curricular activity is scheduled, administration will require adequate caregiver supervision to ensure necessary support to manage crisis behaviors that could occur at any time. If the shift is short of staff for any span of time, trips or outings will be cancelled until additional staff / caregivers are present.  

Children were interviewed and denied any supervision concerns. Children stated during awake hours there are 4 staff members that watch them, and 2 at night. Children made no additional outcries.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found through the course of the investigation that the victim child was exhibiting high risk behaviors all day and was allowed to participate in an outing which led to the child being able to flee from the staff twice.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy administrators and treatment personnel shall establish / review High Risk Behavior policy to ensure all components of safety and supervision are defined, documented, and reviewed for children exhibiting high risk behaviors.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found through the course of the investigation that while on an outing, there was one staff member present with 6 children during an activity and one staff member was in the car. Three children were on a 1:1 supervision plan, where four staff should have been present instead of one.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the operation: Effective immediately, when an extra-curricular activity is scheduled, administration will require adequate caregiver supervision to ensure necessary support to manage crisis behaviors that could occur at any time.   If the shift is short staffed for any span or time, outings will be cancelled until additional staff / caregivers are present. 
When scheduling off campus activities, Gold Star Academy will ensure children with 1:1 requirements or needs will have a designated caregiver to always provide that support.  Gold Star Academy will ensure that any volunteer utilized, has received the trainings that are required for program caregivers.

Children were interviewed and made no outcries of supervision. Children stated that on outings there are 4 staff members present. Staff were also interviewed and had a very good understanding of the ratio, and stated on outings, 4 staff members are present.

Deficiency Narrative: During review of documentation from the investigation, it was found that the child's service plan references other children's names.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Effective immediately, Gold Star Academy treatment personnel will review, edit, and correct misprints within the most recent service plan for each child.  Any names or references that are mistakenly present, will be corrected by removal.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing documentation from the investigation, it was found that the operation did not follow the child's Planned Interventions documented in the service plan.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy administrators and treatment personnel will ensure that staff and caregivers are operating within the guidelines and recommended interventions noted in the childs service plan.  Treatment personnel will review each childs service plan with all caregivers and will ensure that each caregiver is aware of and compliantly implementing service plan strategies and interventions per child.   A service plan review / training, conducted by the Treatment Director, shall occur by August 20, 2024. Confirmation of attendance will be documented with a certificate of completion and recorded in the employee training file.

Deficiency Narrative: Two incident reports did not include the name of both staff present for the incident. (6) One incident report did not include details about the incident and only included one sentence. (5) Both incident reports did not include the names of resident witnesses.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: :  Going forward all serious incident documentation will have all the required information:  Name of Staff present, all required details about the incident, and name of Resident witnesses.

Deficiency Narrative: Two service plans, for two different children, contained the exact same information, word for word, in the supervision section. One service plan had another child's name listed.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy will ensure that all documentation will be thoroughly critiqued to reflect all information is true and accurate in the childrens records.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee was rehired without an approved background check.
Correction Narrative: The BGC was submitted and received on 1/25/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found through the investigation that when CCI went to the operation they could not access the medication and med log locked in the med room due to staff member on shift not having a key.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: "Effective Immediately, Gold Star Academy administrators have created an additional set of facility keys that shall be always available to the staff leaders.  Keys will be stored in a safe location, designated by the administrator."

Deficiency Narrative: It was found in 2 out of 2 children's discharge documents that the list of medications, dosage, frequency and the prescription reason was missing.
Correction Narrative: A document was received from the operation with the corrected discharge summary.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found in 2 out of 2 children's discharge documents reviewed the address and phone number of the person to whom the child was discharged to was missing.
Correction Narrative: A document was received from the operation with the corrected discharge summary.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff told children they could not play the video game or have outings because of the many RCCR investigations at the placement.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy's Administrator reviewed with staff Children's Rights and Discipline after staff attended a training on Complex Trauma on 12/1/2023.  Administrator will ensure that children are not being traumatized by staff by observing shifts and continued training.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, it was discovered the operation failed to remove an inactive  employees within required 7 days timeframe.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy will review BGC in daily staffing when an employee is no longer working at Gold Star to ensure that the background check has been removed from the BGC system.  Administrator will follow-up to ensure BGC has been removed.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI policy reviewed was missing several required sections to include policy in orientation, how children in care will be aware of the policy, the prohibitions of retaliation, and the specific restraints allowed.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star Academy will continue to review and update policies to ensure that the policy includes EBI in orientation for children and the prohibitions of retaliation and specific restraints allowed. Administrator will ensure that policies are updated.

Deficiency Narrative: Video footage observed shows a child laying on the floor with back on ground. The child's arms are crossed in front on chest and staff is holding them in place.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the operation: Gold Star Academy will continue to train in de-escalation/EBIs and safety when a proper restraint is necessary.  Administrator and Supervisors will ensure that staff are not using a prone or supine restraint, but properly using de-escalation methods that they have been trained in.

Deficiency Narrative: Two videos were filmed on an employee's personal device of children in care. The employee no longer works at the operation; however, videos were still accessible.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star Academy will ensure that employees at the operation are not using phones or any other device to tape children.  Administrator has talked with the employees to ensure that this standard is met.  The employee no longer works at Gold Star.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined through the course of the investigation that a staff member stated that a child made an outcry to him about the incident, and it was never reported to the hotline.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star Academy will continue to train staff of Serious Incident Reporting.  Serious Incidents will be documented  and discussed in daily staffing.  Administrator will follow-up to ensure that all Serious Incidents are reported to the hotline timely.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, it was determined that the child's new level of care and supervision requirements were not accurately documented in the service plan. In addition, a document reported to have been written could not be found.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star Academy will ensure that Service Plan information is accurately documented in the Service Plan.  The Treatment Director will be responsible for reviewing Service Plans, and the Administrator will follow-up.

Deficiency Narrative: During a site visit conducted medication was observed not to be under double lock.
Correction Narrative: It was found during inspection that the facility has a double lock.This was also seen at the monitoring from 4/17/2023.The facility also emailed that they will Gold Star Academy will ensure that at all times medication is doubled locked.  Administrator will check daily during physical site inspections, and Supervisors will check after medication is administered.The inspection number for this follow up is 	3948738.

Deficiency Narrative: During a site visit it was observed that refrigerated medication was not stored in a locked container.
Correction Narrative: It was found that the facility had a storage box with a lock for medication that needed to be refrigerated. Currently there are no residents that have medication that need to be refrigerated. The inspection number for this follow up is 	3948738.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children's records reviewed during a site visit were missing the medical consent form and also listed a staff member as the backup consenter.
Correction Narrative: It was observed that that the medical consenter form was corrected.The facility also stated that Gold Star Academy will ensure that Medical Consent forms are apart of each childrens file.  The inspection number for this follow up is 	3948738.Administrator will check at the time of placement, and follow-up with caseworker.  Administrator will also follow-up during daily staffing to ensure this task meets minimum standard requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication logs reviewed did not document allergies or contraindications.
Correction Narrative: It has been observed during an inspection that the facility has adopted a log that has the contraindications/allergies. This was also seen and observed during the last monitoring 4/17/23. The operation also stated that Gold Star Academy will ensure that medication logs have allergies and or contraindications on mediation logs.  Medication logs are reviewed daily by the Administrator to ensure this task meets minimum standards requirements.The inspection number for this follow up is 	3948738.

Deficiency Narrative: During a site visit medication logs were reviewed for two children and did not document the actual time medication was administered.
Correction Narrative: It was observed that time and date was on the medication log during the inspection.The inspection number for this follow up is 	3948738.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that  the operation did not have unauthorized absence logs for Licensing to review.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated that they have created a binder for Unauthorized Absences which includes the Debriefing Form.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found during inspection that the operation did not have an accepted physical or electronic cumulative medication log record and the name of the person and signature administering the medication or if the child refused. There was also a repetitive time for each of the dosages.
Correction Narrative: It was found during inspection that the operation did not have an accepted physical or electronic cumulative medication log record and the name of the person and signature administering the medication or if the child refused. There was also a repetitive time for each of the dosages.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found during inspection that a water drainage system door did not have a lock and was accessible to children in care.

During the monitoring inspection it was found that the agency rescheduled the appointment which was set for 12/6/22 the agency called the previous week to reschedule the appointment but failed to show prior documentation of the original missed.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star Academy will ensure that all appointments are documented on the appointment calendar and documentation is attached.  If an emergency situation arises, and the appointment is rescheduled, that documentation will be kept with the original appointment.  Facility Assistant will keep a calendar for all appointments.  Administrator will follow-up.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection it was found the fire drill expired as of 10/18/21 but the fire drill was delayed due to the agency waiting on an inspection to be scheduled which was done on 11/1/2022.
The child's caseworker was not notified in a timely matter regarding an incident that occurred at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation was observed to be using serious incident reports and reporting to parents immediately.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children were able to engage in sexualized activities without the staff being aware.
Correction Narrative: The operation called to state they are admin reviewing this investigation. The information was submitted while the Licensing Rep was out. There was a follow up done when the rep was out.4/17/23 there was an inspection done with CCR Supervisor Monica Williams done addressing the supervision concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children were neglectfully supervised which allowed the children to engage in sexualized activities.
Correction Narrative: The operation called to state they are admin reviewing this investigation. The information was submitted while the Licensing Rep was out. There was a follow up done when the rep was out.4/17/23 there was an inspection done with CCR Supervisor Monica Williams done addressing the supervision concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have documentation for a restraint a child in care received.
Correction Narrative:
11/11/2022: Operation staff emailed HHSC Staff copies of the sign in sheets, and certificates for staff in training for EBI Refresher. 

10/28/2022: Per operation staff, all employees will be trained on 11/10-11 with an external trainer. Training certificates will be sent upon completion of training

10/28/2022: HHSC Staff asked if the operation has recently provided training to all caregivers due to the investigation, in regard to the wording "will continue to train". I requested the certificates and sign-in log to show that the training was conducted in response to the findings of the investigation. I also requested more details and information on how going forward the operation will ensure that restraints are conducted properly, as well as timely documentation. 

10/27/2022: Operation staff sent notification that GSA will continue to train caregivers in de-escalation techniques and proper restraints. GSA will also continue to train caregivers in the importance of documenting EBI's in the Child's records after the initiation of the intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was placed in a prone restraint.
Correction Narrative:
11/11/2022: Operation staff emailed HHSC Staff copies of the sign in sheets, and certificates for staff in training for EBI Refresher. 

10/28/2022: Per operation staff, all employees will be trained on 11/10-11 with an external trainer. Training certificates will be sent upon completion of training

10/28/2022: HHSC Staff asked if the operation has recently provided training to all caregivers due to the investigation, in regard to the wording "will continue to train". I requested the certificates and sign-in log to show that the training was conducted in response to the findings of the investigation. I also requested more details and information on how going forward the operation will ensure that restraints are conducted properly, as well as timely documentation. 

10/27/2022: Operation staff sent notification that GSA will continue to train caregivers in de-escalation techniques and proper restraints. GSA will also continue to train caregivers in the importance of documenting EBI's in the Child's records after the initiation of the intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection three out of three personnel files did not include a signed statement by the employee indicating they agree to report abuse, neglect, and exploitation.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent the following:The operation will ensure that all staff sign the reporting abuse, neglect and exploitation policy in the employment packet during Orientation.  Administrator will follow-up with Trainer after Orientation to review the file and ensure that abuse, neglect and exploitation policy has been signed.

Deficiency Narrative: The child fell and hit his head on the cement on 01/06/22 and was not take to the hospital for his injuries until 01/13/22. The child complained of headaches between that date.
Correction Narrative:
On 5/17/22 The operation wrote:

Gold Star Academy will ensure that children in care receive medical care when an injury, illness or pain occurs.  When an injury, illness or pain is reported, child in care will be taken to ER or Urgent Care for an assessment.  Administrator will be responsible for immediately having child transported to ER or Urgent Care after a injury, illness, or complaints of pain is reported.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provided the child's Case Worker with an incident report.
Correction Narrative:
5/17/22 The operation wrote: 
Gold Star Academy will ensure that Serious Incident Reports are reported to Parents regarding any injury or illness that warrants treatment from a physician immediately after it happens.  Case Manager will make the report. Treatment Director an Administrator will ensure that the Report has been made during daily staffing.

The facility stated they are going to admin review. The facility stated they did contact the case worker in January.

Deficiency Narrative: The chemical cabinets in the laundry room were unlocked.
Correction Narrative: The chemical cabinets in the laundry room were unlocked.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple documents were not provided as requested to the Investigator during course of the investigation.
Correction Narrative:
We are submitting this correction as a requirement, but this does not waive our due process rights. 
Gold Star Academy will ensure that records are available and provided to licensing upon request.  Campus Manager, Compliance and Supervisors will ensure.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member threatened a child to a fight on a separate occasion.
Correction Narrative:
We are submitting this correction as a requirement, but this does not waive our due process rights. 
The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Gold Star Academy. Gold Star Academy will continue to train in Corporal Punishment and ensure that staff are not threatening children. Campus Manager, Compliance and Supervisors will ensure that staff are properly using De-escalation methods.

On 4/11/22, Three children were interviewed in a private room at Twin Creek Elementary. Three of three children stated they lived at Gold Star in 2021. Three of three children stated there was no corporal punishment that took place at Gold Star including being hit, spanked or unproductive worker. The complete interviews are available in the Chrono.

Deficiency Narrative: An incident was witnessed by both kids and staff in the home. This incident was not reported to Licensing.
Correction Narrative: Gold Star submitted the following corrections after the upheld admin penalty: Gold Star Academy will ensure that Serious Incidents are reported to Licensing as soon as they are aware of allegations or indications of abuse, neglect, or exploitation of a child.  Case Manager will make report, Administrator and Assistant Administrator will ensure that report has been made. Additionally, the licensing rep reviewed serious incident reports during their last monitoring visit on

Deficiency Narrative: A child sustaining injuries to his neck as a result of having his shirt pulled by Staff during a restraint.
Correction Narrative:
On 6/28/22, a physical follow up took place at the children's summer camp. All interviews conducted by RCCR Lauren Burke on behalf of RCCR Carla McGowen. Full interviews are viewable in the Chronology. 3 of 3 children stated there were no issues of hurt or pain during a restraint at the facility.

Gold Star submitted the following corrections after the upheld admin penalty: Gold Star Academy will continue to train in de-escalation/EBIs and safety when a restraint is necessary.  Administrator and Assistant Administrator will ensure that staff are properly using de-escalation methods.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation allowed a contracted group therapist to work in the presence of children before submitting or receiving an initial background check determination.
Correction Narrative:
The agency has submitted the background check for David Hogan on 5.5.21. As of today, the results are still pending. I spoke to the operation and they advised that they have requested an admin review. 

Gold Star submitted the following corrections after the upheld admin penalty: Gold Star Academy will ensure that background check notifications have been received prior to allowing individuals to be present at operation.  HR and Compliance will ensure this task is completed. 
In a follow call on 7/23/22, Anita Johnson
Compliance and Program Development Manager determined that she will be changing the status of Mr. Hogan on all of the operations.

Deficiency Narrative: Medical logs were observed not completely filled out. Log information for the child's insulin were not complete and/or consistent.
Correction Narrative: A written corrective action plan was submitted by the operation stating the following: GSA will ensure that medication logs are completed and consistent with medication administered. Medication logs are checked daily by medication specialist and random reviews are done weekly by administrator to ensure medication logs are true, accurate, and correct.

Deficiency Narrative: Facility did not follow the correct formula to administer insulin dosages to the child.
Correction Narrative: A written corrective action plan was submitted by the operation stating the following: GSA will ensure that staff who administer medications with formulas are trained by a medical professional to ensure medication is administered properly to prevent harm to children. Administrator, medication specialist, as well as supervisor, will be responsible for checking formulas before medication is administered.

Deficiency Narrative: There was a rope with a large circular opening hanging from a tree in the backyard being used by children in care as a swing.
Three of three bathrooms observed did not have paper towels in the bathroom available for use.
5 of 14 beds were missing mattress covers. 1 of 14 beds was missing a sheet.
Food was stored on the floor and stored near poisonous/hazardous items.
All forms and documents need to be thoroughly completed. These include incident reports, work orders, child and activity logs etc.
Correction Narrative: All forms and documents need to be thoroughly completed. These include incident reports, work orders, child and activity logs etc.
